title: AirTalk
description: Join KPCC's AirTalk with host Larry Mantle weekdays for lively and in-depth discussions of city news, politics, science, the arts, entertainment, and more.

title: Patt Morrison
description: Patt Morrison is a live two-hour public affairs show. The program is known for its innovative discussions of local politics and culture, and for its presentation of national and world news as it affects Southern California.

title: FilmWeek
description:
FilmWeek on AirTalk, hosted by Larry Mantle, is a one-hour weekly segment devoted to films. It offers reviews of the week's new movies, interviews with filmmakers, and discussions on various aspects of the industry.

Get the Filmweek Podcast

title: The Loh Down On Science
description: The Loh Down on Science is the fun way to get your daily dose of science in less than two minutes. The program explains the world of science with a dash of humor. Hosted by writer/performer and Caltech alumna Sandra Tsing Loh, it's a program for those who love science as well as for those who avoid it!

title: The Loh Life
airtime: Mondays during Morning Edition and All Things Considered
description: The Loh Life is Writer and performer Sandra Tsing Loh's irreverent weekly take on life in early 21st century Southern California. She talks about motherhood, politics, pop culture, and more.

title: Off-Ramp
airtime: Saturday Noon to 1:00 p.m. and Sunday 6:00 to 7:00 p.m.
description: Off-Ramp is a lively weekly look at Southern California through the eyes and ears of radio veteran John Rabe. News, arts, home, life... covering everything that makes life here exciting, enjoyable, and interesting.

title: Street Stories
description:
In Southern California, there are majestic avenues like Imperial Highway or Victory Boulevard. There are also romantic roads like Sunset or Laurel Canyon. For every street, there's a history. KPCC has found some of the stories you can find right under your tires.

Are there Southland street names you're curious about? Let us know by leaving a comment on any entry below.

title: Marc Haefele
airtime: Wednesday afternoons on All Things Considered
description: Marc Haefele, dean of the city hall reporters for Los Angeles, discusses Southern California issues with KPCC's Alex Cohen.

title: Business Update with Mark Lacter
description: Once a week, business analyst Mark Lacter joins KPCC for a look at economic issues in Southern California.

title: Pacific Drift
airtime: January 2005 to July 2006 - The last program aired on July 2, 2006.
description: Pacific Drift ® - Using the lenses of art, culture, and documentary to explore issues specific to Southern California, Pacific Drift focused on untouched artistic resources in and around the region. Pacific Drift also featured documentaries about life in Southern California.

title: Town Hall Journal
description:
TOWN HALL Journal is a lively, informative radio magazine, hosted by Emmy and Peabody award-winning broadcast journalist Judy Muller, and presented by Town Hall Los Angeles, Los Angeles’ premier platform for public speaking. Each week, the program draws upon Town Hall speakers past and present for an in-depth look into political, economic and cultural issues affecting the daily lives of Angelenos.

More Town Hall info at:
www.townhall-la.org

title: StoryCorps
description:
KPCC is hosting StoryCorps in LA for three weeks, at the California African American Museum beginning on October 23. Make an appointment to record a story by making a reservation today!

StoryCorps is an independent nonprofit, whose mission is to provide people of all backgrounds and beliefs with the opportunity to record, share, and preserve the stories of our lives.

title: TitleWave
description: Sit down with KPCC’s Patt Morrison and a good book every Friday -- the authors of some of the most exciting writing around -- novels and nonfiction -- talk about their books, and read aloud from some of their favorite passages.

title: Comedy Congress
description: Everyone’s favorite congress is back in session. With brand new clips from our beloved elected officials, Patt Morrison and Comedy Congress ™ brings you the type of comedy that only your tax dollars could pay for. We believe that when politics makes you want to cry, it’s usually best to laugh.

title: Ask the Chief
description: From Bratton to Beck – Patt sits down with the Chief of the Los Angeles Police Department each month with “Ask the Chief.” Listeners use the line to pull over the head of the largest local law enforcement agency in the United States.

title: Big Man on Campus
description: Don’t be tardy! No hand raising required for Patt’s monthly sit down with LAUSD superintendent Ramon Cortines. All topics are covered in today’s curriculum as Patt directs listener questions and comments to the man at the helm of the largest school system in California.

title: FilmWeek Marquee
airtime: Friday during All Things Considered and Saturday during Weekend Edition
description: A three-minute rundown of the best (and worst) of this week’s film releases, including the go-to movie for the weekend. If you like the Marquee, check out the full hour FilmWeek podcast, with more reviews, entertainment news and interviews.

title: Eat-LA
description: The Eat-LA/Off-Ramp Collaboration pits the vast resources and expertise of Eat-LA, a comprehensive online guide to food in Los Angeles, against Off-Ramp host John Rabe’s appetite for geographic and gustatory exploration. Every other week, listeners to The Eat-LA/Off-Ramp Collaboration can expect to discover a new place to eat and drink, or a great place to buy the raw materials, or new trends in food and drink.

title: The Madeleine Brand Show
description: The Madeleine Brand Show, exclusively on 89.3 KPCC, 89.1 KUOR and 90.3 KVLA, captures the spirit of the West in a conversational, informal, witty style and examines the cultural issues people are buzzing about. Hosted by Madeleine Brand, and produced by Kristen Muller, Steve Proffitt and Sanden Totten, the show includes regular segments like Weird L.A. - highlighting a person, place or thing that you've never heard about, but probably should; Parenting on the Edge - a weekly discussion on the challenges and pitfalls of raising kids; as well as regular contributors like Luke Burbank, Rico Gagliano, Brendan Newnam and John Moe  to help dissect culture, technology and business news.

title: Off-Ramp Extra
description: Extended interviews, nuggets from the archives, essays and rants, casual conversation, new music you should hear ... Off-Ramp Extra is a daily dose of Off-Ramp, hosted by KPCC's John Rabe.

title: Take Two
description: Take Two, exclusively on 89.3 KPCC, 89.1 KUOR and 90.3 KVLA, captures the spirit of the West in a conversational, informal, witty style and examines the cultural issues people are buzzing about. E-mail us at taketwoshow@scpr.org.

title: Brand & Martínez
description: Brand & Martínez, exclusively on 89.3 KPCC, 89.1 KUOR and 90.3 KVLA, captures the spirit of the West in a conversational, informal, witty style and examines the cultural issues people are buzzing about. Hosted by Madeleine Brand and A Martínez, and produced by Kristen Muller, Steve Proffitt and Sanden Totten, the show includes regular segments like Weird L.A. - highlighting a person, place or thing that you've never heard about, but probably should; Parenting on the Edge - a weekly discussion on the challenges and pitfalls of raising kids; as well as regular contributors like Luke Burbank, Rico Gagliano, Brendan Newnam and John Moe  to help dissect culture, technology and business news.

title: Take Two Evenings
description: Take Two Evenings is the one hour edition of KPCC's daily news magazine Take Two, looking at news and culture through the lens of Southern California.

title: BBC World Service
host: a team of expert Correspondents & Journalists
airtime: Monday-Thursday nights Midnight-2 a.m.; Saturday 1-5 a.m.; Sunday Midnight-5 a.m.; Sunday night 10 p.m.-2 a.m.
description: The BBC World Service provides international news and analysis from around the globe in 28 languages. Their global network of correspondents provides impartial news and reports on location.

title: The California Report
description: The California Report takes a look at the week's news, arts and cultural events affecting California and its diverse population by providing in-depth analysis and stories. Produced by KQED.

title: Latino USA
description: Latino USA chronicles how Latinos are living, shaping and changing America, with in-depth reporting and candid conversations.

title: Marketplace
description: Every weekday on Marketplace, Kai Ryssdal hosts a lively and unexpected exploration of the day’s business and economic news from Wall Street to your wallet.

title: Marketplace Money
description: Every weekend, Marketplace Money brings the week’s economic headlines home by looking at matters of personal finance with wit and wisdom.

title: Marketplace Morning Report
description: Start your day with an up-to-the-minute report on the world of business and finance with host David Brancaccio.

title: A Prairie Home Companion
description: A Prairie Home Companion is a recorded live show featuring comedy sketches, music and more from host Garrison Keillor and company.

title: On Being
description: On Being is a conversation about the big questions at the center of human life, from the boldest new science of the human brain to the most ancient traditions of the human spirit.

title: The Splendid Table
description: Hosted by Lynne Rosetto Kasper, The Splendid Table celebrates food and its ability to touch the lives and feed the souls of everyone. The one-hour culinary, culture, and lifestyle program provides interviews, views on food policy as well as recipes and kitchen tips.

title: On The Media
description: On The Media, hosted by Bob Garfield and Brooke Gladstone, is America's only national radio program devoted to media criticism and analysis, lifting the veil on how the media works.

title: The Story
description: People tell stories; all the time. The Story searches them out and bundles them up into a daily show full of people whose lives are intersecting with significant issues in the news.

title: The Tavis Smiley Show
description: The Tavis Smiley Show is a high-energy exchange of views, information, and insight hosted by Tavis Smiley with guests from diverse points of view.

title: This American Life
description: This American Life describes contemporary life with themed episodes and a variety of stories on that theme — mostly true stories of everyday people, though not always.  The stories presented are engaging, intimate, surprising, funny, disturbing and bittersweet.

title: The World
description: An award-winning daily show, “PRI's The World” brings one-of-a-kind international stories home to America. "The World's" coverage is provided by a global network of international journalists, including access to 250 BBC correspondents.

title: The Writer's Almanac
description: Each day, Garrison Keillor reads a poem and relates stories of significant events touching literary history.

title: All Things Considered
host: Robert Siegel, Melissa Block and Audie Cornish
airtime: Monday-Friday 3:30-6:30 p.m.; Saturday 5-6 p.m.; Sunday 5-6 p.m.
description: All Things Considered brings you stories of the day, thoughtful commentaries and insightful features on arts and life, music and entertainment, all brought alive through sound.

title: Car Talk
description: Car Talk, hosted by brothers and long-time mechanics Ray and Tom Magliozzi (better known as "Click and Clack, The Tappet Brothers"), offers an hour of car repair advice from a humorous perspective, to say the least.

title: Fresh Air
description: Fresh Air with Terry Gross is weekday magazine of contemporary arts and issues with intimate conversations and unusual insights.

title: Morning Edition
description: Morning Edition delivers up-to-the-minute news, analysis and commentary, mixed with the latest Southern California news from the KPCC newsroom.

title: Science Friday
description: Science Friday with host Ira Flatow discusses the latest in science, technology, health, and the environment. It's brain fun, for curious people.

title: Talk of the Nation
description: Talk of the Nation, hosted by Neal Conan, offers call-in listeners the opportunity to join enlightening discussions about politics, public service, health care, education, religion, and music with decision-makers, authors, academicians, and artists from around the world.

title: Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!
description: Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me! is a fast-paced and irreverent quiz show that tests your knowledge against the best and brightest in the news and entertainment world.

title: Weekend Edition Saturday
description: Saturday mornings are made for Weekend Edition Saturday, which wraps up the week's news and offers analysis and features on the arts, sports, and entertainment.

title: Weekend Edition Sunday
description: Weekend Edition Sunday brings listeners the news of the day in combination with distinctive interviews, colorful arts and human interest stories, and a popular weekly puzzle from Will Shortz.

title: The Moth Radio Hour
description:
The Moth Radio Hour features true stories told live on stage without scripts, notes, props, or accompaniment.

The episodes displayed are not the full Radio Hour. For the full program, visit the Moth Radio Hour Website.

title: The Dinner Party
host: Rico Gagliano and Brendan Francis Newnam
description: Want to be the star of this weekend's dinner party? The Dinner Party provides  a fast and funny “booster shot” of unconventional news, cuisine and culture to help you win.

title: Marketplace Tech Report
description: Marketplace Tech is a daily 4-minute show exploring how technology is shaping our lives.

title: Radiolab
airtime: Friday 11:00 p.m. to Midnight, Sunday 4:00 to 5:00 p.m.
description: Radiolab is a show about curiosity. Where sound illuminates ideas, and the boundaries blur between science, philosophy, and human experience. Produced by WNYC.

title: Snap Judgment
airtime: Saturday 4:00 to 5:00 p.m. and Sunday 3:00 to 4:00 p.m.
description: Snap Judgment delivers a raw brand of compelling personal stories, mixing tall tales with killer tunes. It’s storytelling… with a beat.

title: Smiley & West
description: Smiley & West is a high-energy exchange of views, information, and insights. Tavis and Cornel West engage commentators and guests in substantive and provocative discussions on a wide range of topics, including politics, health, finance, sports, technology, and pop culture.

title: BBC Newshour
host: a rotating group of seasoned BBC journalists
description: BBC's most experienced correspondents bring you compelling interviews on every subject. From devastating natural disasters to inspiring triumphs of the human spirit, BBC Newshour has the world covered.

title: Drucker on the Dial
airtime: New shows available the second Friday of every month
description:
A show on management and leadership where timely issues meet timeless principles. The Drucker Institute's Phalana Tiller hosts this hour-long, monthly interview program that focuses on management and leadership through a lens that is both timely and timeless. Well-known guests — executives, authors, academics and others — discuss topics that spring right from the headlines. At the same time, the conversation is informed by the teachings of Peter F. Drucker, described by BusinessWeek as "the man who invented management."


The program is available the second Friday of every month.

title: Tell Me More
description: Tell Me More brings fresh voices and perspectives to public radio, capturing the headlines, issues and pleasures relevant to multicultural life in the U.S.

title: TED Radio Hour
description: TED Radio Hour draws from the vast archive of TED Talks and weaves in new interviews to tackle a central theme or question. It’s a journey through fascinating ideas, astonishing inventions, and new ways to think and create.

title: Bullseye
description: Bullseye is equal parts funny and fascinating. Whether you're already plugged in to the culture map, or looking for a signpost, Bullseye keeps you on target.

title: Wits
description: Wits is a conversation, comedy, songs and surprises, hosted by John Moe. Recorded live at the Fitzgerald Theater, Wits brings together world-class comedians, actors and musicians for a night they – and the audience – will never forget.

title: Ask Me Another
description: Ask me Another blends brainteasers and local pub trivia night with comedy and music played in front of a live audience. The show is a co-production of NPR and WNYC.
